oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Map of 82nd Division, Meuse Argonne Offensive, September 29 - November 2, 1918
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Produced by the American Battle Monuments Commission in 1937, this map was found at the Alvin C. York site and may have belonged to York. It depicts the entire Argonne Forest sector over which the American 82nd Division, including York's Co. G, 328th Inf. Rgt., attacked German positions in late 1918. It shows the American lines on Oct. 8, south of Hill 223. For York's actions that day-eliminating withering machine gun fire & capturing 132 Germans-he received the Medal of Honor.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:instructionalMethod: 5.44; US.28; US.30; Alvin C. York; World War I
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
